title: Google\Cloud\Logging\Logger
name: Logger
description: A logger used to write entries to Google Stackdriver Logging.

params.name: connection
params.description: Represents a connection to Stackdriver Logging.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the log to write entries to.

params.name: projectId
params.description: The project's ID.

params.name: resource
params.description: The monitored resource to associate log entries with. Defaults to type global.

params.name: labels
params.description: A set of user-defined (key, value) data that provides additional information about the log entries.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes this log and all its log entries. The log will reappear if it receives new entries.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options.

methods.name: entries
methods.description:
Fetches entries scoped to the selected log.

Please note that a default filter specifying the logName will be applied for you.

examples.caption: Use an advanced logs filter to fetch only entries with a specific payload.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.filter
params.description: An advanced logs filter.

params.name: options.orderBy
params.description: How the results should be sorted. Presently, the only permitted values are timestamp asc and timestamp desc. Defaults to "timestamp asc".

params.name: options.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of results to return per request.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

methods.name: entry
methods.description: Creates an entry which which can be written to a log. In order to write the entry to the log please use Google\Cloud\Logging\Logger::write() or Google\Cloud\Logging\Logger::writeBatch().

examples.caption: Create an entry with a key/value set of data
Create an entry with a severity of EMERGENCY and specifying a resource.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to log. When providing a string the data will be stored as a textPayload type. When providing an array the data will be stored as a jsonPayload type.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.resource
params.description: The monitored resource to associate this log entry with. Defaults to type global.

params.name: options.httpRequest
params.description: Information about the HTTP request associated with this log entry, if applicable. Please see the API docs for more information.

params.name: options.labels
params.description: A set of user-defined (key, value) data that provides additional information about the log entry.

params.name: options.operation
params.description: Additional information about a potentially long-running operation with which a log entry is associated. Please see the API docs for more information.

params.name: options.severity
params.description: The severity of the log entry. Defaults to "DEFAULT".

params.name: options.insertId
params.description: A unique identifier for the log entry.

params.name: options.timestamp
params.description: The timestamp associated with this entry. If providing a string it must be in RFC3339 UTC "Zulu" format. Example: "2014-10-02T15:01:23.045123456Z". If explicitly set to null the timestamp will be generated by the server at the moment the entry is received (with nanosecond precision). Defaults to the current time, generated by the client with microsecond precision.

methods.name: write
methods.description: Write a single entry to the log.

examples.caption: Writing a simple entry with a key/value set of data and a severity of EMERGENCY.
Using the entry factory method to write a log entry.

params.name: entry
params.description: The entry to write to the log.

params.name: options
params.description: Please see Google\Cloud\Logging\Logger::entry() to see the options that can be applied to a log entry. Please note that if the provided entry is of type Entry these options will overwrite those that may already be set on the instance.

methods.name: writeBatch
methods.description: Write a set of entries to the log.

params.name: entries
params.description: Entries to write to the log.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options.
